title: Why isn't kys automatically censored?
body: We all know this an acronym telling people to kill themselves (I've NEVER seen this used in a kind way). I don't understand why it isn't automatically censored like some of the other derogatory terms people use.

replies.body: I'd personally just like to see rito add a "filter" feature to the chat thing where you can ban out your own phrases and such (with a potential "uncensored" option if you're someone like me who actively enjoys playing with their food). Then the playerbase can tune the chat to what they do/don't want to hear.

there was an old joke i read on the internet back when people were really into coming up with acronyms for instant messaging and chat rooms. I'm gonna be paraphrasing it down hard as i vaguely remember the details but i remember the point of it. 

The guy was playing an online game like chess or something and the opponent won and he wanted to give some reply to show he wasn't a poor sport right. So he thinks to himself ill reply with "good for you" but ill shorten it to "gfy" and be mr l33t. The opponent get offended of course and the guy doesnt understand why till he explains what he thinks gfy stands for. 

Ya i know i told it bad and you probably figured it out at gfy or good for you but the point is this story i remember from like 2002 maybe? and i didn't even know that acronym at the time. Some people don't and some do and it's not something that should be auto dealt with but maybe case by case and in the context of the conversation and game. but that is just my two cents.

You can always pull the thing blizzard pulled with "gg ez" in overwatch, but really, it won't matter in the end.

In terms of the chat filter, I don't know how easy it is to update it, but I do know for a fact that it won't stop people from saying it anyway, for example, typing it one line at a time, like so:
>k
>y
>s

or they could always go a step further and just type out the entire phrase. A chat filter won't stop toxicity, it only slows it down.
